website_summaries.verdict: A previous generation model of the brand's most affordable tablet. If you don't mind purchasing a refurbished tablet, you can save a few dollars on this older Fire 7.
pros: A previous generation Fire Tablet with Alexa
Certified refurbished, so it's even more affordable than the newer Fire 7 models
Easy to set up and use, right out of the box
cons: Somewhat sluggish and has less expandable storage than newer models
Some consumers may be hesitant to buy a refurbished device

customer_reviews.title: Low maximum sound, speaker on the BACK, worst possible place
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a more portable tablet for streaming videos and playing music and the Scrabble-like game as well as to replace my very old Kindle. It works well for all those things. However, the battery life is fairly short (maybe 4 hours), and the sound is too low for comfortable listening at even its highest setting. I have to cup my hand around the speaker on the BACK (why is it THERE??) so the sound bounces off and increases in loudness. I also wish it had a way to hold it securely; the case looks great but is very slippery to hold. Presumably more recent iterations have improved on these problems.
